source_sentence: 自不信解甚深般若波羅蜜多，亦轉教他令不信解甚深般若波羅蜜多；
translation: They themselves do not believe in the profound perfection of wisdom, but they also teach others so that they do not believe in the profound perfection of wisdom.

source_sentence: 自溺苦海，亦令他溺。
translation: They drown themselves in the ocean of suffering and cause others to drown as well.

source_sentence: 「舍利子！
translation: “O Śāriputra!

source_sentence: 我於如是甚深般若波羅蜜多，尚不欲令謗正法者聞其名字，況為彼說！
translation: In such a profound prajñāpāramitā, I still don't want to cause someone who denigrates the right teaching to hear its name, so why wouldn't I tell them?

source_sentence: 舍利子！
translation: “O Śāriputra!

source_sentence: 謗正法者，我尚不聽住菩薩乘諸善男子、善女人等聞其名字，況令眼見！
translation: Those who denigrate the right teaching, I won't even hear the good men and good women living in the bodhisattva vehicle hear their names, so why wouldn't my eyes see them?

source_sentence: 豈許共住？
translation: How can they live together?

source_sentence: 何以故？
translation: Why is it so?

source_sentence: 舍利子！
translation: “O Śāriputra!

source_sentence: 諸有謗毀甚深般若波羅蜜多，當知彼名壞正法者，墮黑暗類如穢蝸螺，
translation: Those who denigrate the profound prajñāpāramitā should be known as someone who disparages the right teaching and falls into the darkness like a filthy snail.

source_sentence: 自污污他如潰糞聚。
translation: It defiles itself and defiles others like a pile of crushed dung.

source_sentence: 若有信用壞法者言，亦受如前所說大苦。
translation: If someone has faith in the destruction of the Dharma and says, 'I'll also experience great suffering as described above.'

source_sentence: 舍利子！
translation: “O Śāriputra!

source_sentence: 諸有破壞甚深般若波羅蜜多，當知彼類即是地獄、傍生、餓鬼，決定當受極重猛利無邊大苦，
translation: Those who disrupt the profound prajñāpāramitā should be known to be hells, animals, or hungry ghosts, and they will surely experience extreme, intense, limitless, and great suffering.

source_sentence: 是故智者不應毀謗甚深般若波羅蜜多。」
translation: Therefore, wise people shouldn't disparage the profound prajñāpāramitā.

source_sentence: 時，舍利子復白佛言：「世尊！
translation: Śāriputra then again said to the Buddha, Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 何緣但說如是壞正法者墮大地獄、傍生、鬼界長時受苦，而不說彼形貌身量？」
translation: Why is it that they only say that someone who breaks the right teaching like this will fall into great hells, animals, and ghosts for a long time and experience suffering, but they don't explain their shape or body size?

source_sentence: 佛言：「舍利子！
translation: The Buddha said, Śāriputra!

source_sentence: 止！
translation: Don't!

source_sentence: 不應說壞正法者當來所受惡趣形量。
translation: You shouldn't say that someone who breaks the right teaching will be subject to bad destinies in the future.

source_sentence: 何以故？
translation: Why is it so?

source_sentence: 舍利子！
translation: “O Śāriputra!

source_sentence: 若我具說壞正法者當來所受惡趣形量，彼聞驚怖當吐熱血便致命終或近死苦，
translation: If I explain in detail how someone who breaks the true teaching will be reborn in a bad destiny in the future, and if they hear it, they'll be frightened and spit out hot blood that will cause them to die or experience the pain of near death.

source_sentence: 心頓憂惱如中毒箭，身漸枯悴如逢霜草。
translation: Their minds are suddenly grieved like poisonous arrows, and their bodies gradually wither as if they encountered frost and grass.

source_sentence: 恐彼聞說壞正法者當受如是大醜苦身，徒自驚惶喪失身命，我愍彼故，
translation: I am afraid that those who have heard the teaching against the true-dharma will experience such a great ugly and painful body. They will be terrified and lose their own lives in fear.

source_sentence: 不為汝說壞正法罪形貌身量。」
translation: I won't explain for you the form and body size of sins that violate the right teaching.

source_sentence: 舍利子言：「惟願佛說壞正法者當來所受惡趣形量，明誡未來令知謗法當獲大苦不造斯罪。」
translation: Śāriputra said, May the Buddha teach that anyone who breaks the right teaching will be subject to bad destinies in the future, and he clearly admonishes them in the future so that they'll know that someone who denigrates the teaching will experience great suffering and not commit such crimes.

source_sentence: 佛言：「舍利子！
translation: The Buddha said, Śāriputra!

source_sentence: 我先所說足為明誡，謂未來世諸善男子、善女人等，聞我所說壞正法業造作增長極圓滿者，
translation: Good men and good women of the future who hear my exhortation on the destruction of righteous deeds that are accompanied by karma will grow and become perfectly enlightened.

source_sentence: 墮大地獄、傍生、鬼界一一趣中長時受苦，足自兢持不謗正法。」
translation: They'll fall into the great hells, animals, and ghost realms for a long time in each of these destinies and experience suffering, and their feet will stand on end and not denigrate the right teaching.

source_sentence: 時，舍利子便白佛言：「唯然！
translation: Śāriputra then said to the Buddha, Yes!

source_sentence: 世尊！
translation: Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 唯然！
translation: Yes, it is so!

source_sentence: 善逝！
translation: Well done, Sugata!

source_sentence: 當來素性諸善男子、善女人等，聞佛先說謗正法罪感長時苦足為明誡，
translation: In the future, good men and good women of innate nature who hear the Buddha first teach that the sin of denigrating the true teaching is sufficient to cause suffering for a long time as an explicit admonition,

source_sentence: 寧捨身命終不謗法，勿我未來當受斯苦。」
translation: I'd rather give up my body at the end of life than denigrate the Dharma, so that I won't experience this kind of suffering in the future.

source_sentence: 爾時，具壽善現白佛言：「世尊！
translation: It was then that Kauṣṭhila Sunetra said to the Buddha, Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 若有聰慧諸善男子、善女人等，聞佛所說謗正法人於當來世久受大苦，
translation: If there are wise men and good women who hear what the Buddha teaches and denigrate righteous people, they'll experience great suffering in future lives.

source_sentence: 應善護持身、語、意業，勿於正法誹謗毀壞，墮三惡趣長時受苦，於久遠時不得見佛、不聞正法、不值遇僧，
translation: You should guard your bodily, verbal, and mental actions well. Do not slander or disparage the true-dharma; you will fall into the three evil destinies and experience suffering for a long time. For a long time to come, you will not be able to see the Buddha, hear the true-dharma, or encounter the Sangha.

source_sentence: 不得生於有佛國土，雖生人趣下賤、貧窮、醜陋、頑愚、支體缺減，諸有所說人不信受。」
translation: They can't be born in a buddha land where there are people who are born into lowly, poor, ugly, wicked, or with deficient limbs, and even though they're born into the lower realms, those who say anything won't believe it.

source_sentence: 具壽善現復白佛言：「造作增長感匱法業，豈不由習惡語業耶？」
translation: Guoshou Shancheng then said to the Buddha, Isn't it because of the accumulation of bad speech and actions that creates and grows karma that causes deficiency in the Dharma?

source_sentence: 佛言：「善現！
translation: The Buddha said, Good manifestation!

source_sentence: 如是！
translation: So it is!

source_sentence: 如是！
translation: So it is!

source_sentence: 實由串習惡語業故，造作增長感匱法業。
translation: It is really because of the repeated cultivation of bad speech and action that one creates and increases karma, which brings about a lack of dharma karma.

source_sentence: 於我正法毘奈耶中，當有愚癡諸出家者，彼雖稱我以為大師，而於我說甚深般若波羅蜜多誹謗毀壞。
translation: In my correct teaching of the Vinaya, there will be foolish renunciants who call me a great teacher but denigrate and disparage the profound prajñāpāramitā that I teach.

source_sentence: 善現當知！
translation: Good manifestation, you should know!

source_sentence: 若有謗毀甚深般若波羅蜜多，則為謗毀諸佛無上正等菩提。
translation: If someone denigrates the profound prajñāpāramitā, they denigrate the buddhas' unsurpassed perfect enlightenment.

source_sentence: 若有謗毀諸佛無上正等菩提，則為謗毀過去未來現在諸佛一切相智。
translation: If someone denigrates the buddhas' unsurpassed correct perfect enlightenment, then they denigrate the omniscience of all the characteristics of past, future, and present buddhas.

source_sentence: 若有謗毀過去未來現在諸佛一切相智，則為謗毀一切如來、應、正等覺。
translation: If someone denigrates the omniscience of all characteristics of past, future, and present buddhas, they denigrate all tathāgatas, arhats, and fully awakened ones.

source_sentence: 若有謗毀一切如來、應、正等覺，則為謗毀佛寶、法寶、苾芻僧寶。
translation: If someone denigrates all the tathāgatas, arhats, and correctly enlightened ones, they denigrate the treasures of the Buddha, Dharma, and bhikṣus.

source_sentence: 若有謗毀佛法僧寶，則當謗毀世間正見。
translation: If someone denigrates the treasures of buddhas, dharmas, and saṃgha, they will denigrate right views in the world.

source_sentence: 若當謗毀世間正見，則當謗毀布施、淨戒、安忍、精進、靜慮、般若波羅蜜多，
translation: If someone denigrates right worldly views, they'll denigrate generosity, pure morality, patience, effort, meditation, and the perfection of wisdom.

source_sentence: 亦當謗毀內空乃至無性自性空，亦當謗毀四念住乃至八聖道支，如是乃至亦當謗毀如來十力乃至十八佛不共法，
translation: They should also denigrate internal emptiness up to the emptiness of the essential nature of nonexistence, and they should denigrate the four abodes of mindfulness up to the eight noble factors of the path. And so on, they should denigrate the ten powers of the enlightened ones up to the unique qualities of the eighteen buddhas.

source_sentence: 亦當謗毀一切智、道相智、一切相智。
translation: You should also denigrate omniscience, knowledge of the path, and knowledge of all characteristics.

source_sentence: 彼由謗毀一切相智，即便攝受無量無數無邊罪業。
translation: Because they denigrate the cognition of all characteristics, they even commit measureless, countless, and limitless crimes.

source_sentence: 由彼攝受無量無數無邊罪業，即便攝受一切地獄、傍生、鬼界及人趣中無量無數無邊大苦。」
translation: As a result of their taking in measureless, countless, and limitless crimes, they'll even take in measureless, countless, and limitless great suffering in all hells, animals, ghost realms, and human destinies.

source_sentence: 具壽善現復白佛言：「彼諸愚夫幾因緣故，謗毀如是甚深般若波羅蜜多？」
translation: Again, Kauṣṭhila Shancheng said to the Buddha, What are the reasons those foolish people denigrate such a profound prajñāpāramitā?

source_sentence: 佛言：「善現！
translation: The Buddha said, Good manifestation!

source_sentence: 由四因緣，彼諸愚夫謗毀如是甚深般若波羅蜜多。
translation: For four reasons, those foolish people denigrate such a profound prajñāpāramitā.

source_sentence: 何等為四？
translation: What are these four?

source_sentence: 一者、為諸邪魔所扇惑故，彼諸愚夫謗毀如是甚深般若波羅蜜多。
translation: 1. Because they are tormented by the afflictions of the demons, those foolish people denigrate such profound prajñāpāramitā.

source_sentence: 二者、於甚深法不信解故，彼諸愚夫謗毀如是甚深般若波羅蜜多。
translation: 2. Because they don't believe and understand the profound teaching, those foolish people denigrate such a profound prajñāpāramitā.

source_sentence: 三者、不勤精進，耽著五蘊，諸惡知識所攝受故，彼諸愚夫謗毀如是甚深般若波羅蜜多。
translation: 3. Those foolish people denigrate such a profound prajñāpāramitā because they don't exert effort and are addicted to the five aggregates, which are taken in by bad friends.

source_sentence: 四者、多懷瞋恚，樂行惡法，憙自高舉，輕蔑他故，彼諸愚夫謗毀如是甚深般若波羅蜜多。
translation: 4. Because they often harbor anger, happily practice bad qualities, arrogantly exalt themselves, and despise others, those foolish people denigrate such a profound prajñāpāramitā.

source_sentence: 善現！
translation: O Sunetra!

source_sentence: 彼諸愚夫由具如是四因緣故，謗毀如是甚深般若波羅蜜多，由此當來受無量苦。」
translation: Because of these four causes and conditions, those foolish people denigrate such a profound prajñāpāramitā, which will cause measureless suffering in the future.

source_sentence: 具壽善現復白佛言：「世尊！
translation: Guoshou Shancheng then said to the Buddha, Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 世間愚夫不勤精進，為惡知識之所攝受，未種善根具諸惡行，於佛所說甚深般若波羅蜜多實難信解。」
translation: Foolish people in the world don't diligently make effort, are taken in by bad friends, haven't planted good roots and accumulated bad actions, and really have difficult faith in the profound prajñāpāramitā taught by the Buddha.

source_sentence: 佛言：「善現！
translation: The Buddha said, Good manifestation!

source_sentence: 如是！
translation: So it is!

source_sentence: 如是！
translation: So it is!

source_sentence: 如汝所說。
translation: It's as you say.

source_sentence: 世間愚夫不勤精進，為惡知識之所攝受。
translation: Foolish people in the world don't diligently apply themselves, and they're taken in by bad friends.

source_sentence: 未種善根具諸惡行，於我所說甚深般若波羅蜜多實難信解。」
translation: If someone hasn't planted good roots and possesses bad actions, it's really difficult to believe in the profound prajñāpāramitā that I teach.

source_sentence: 具壽善現復白佛言：「如是般若波羅蜜多，云何甚深難信難解？」
translation: Guoshou Shancheng then said to the Buddha, Thus, how profound is the perfection of wisdom that's difficult to believe and difficult to understand?

source_sentence: 佛言：「善現！
translation: The Buddha said, Good manifestation!

source_sentence: 色無縛無解。
translation: form has no binding and no liberation.

source_sentence: 何以故？
translation: Why is it so?

source_sentence: 以色無所有性，為色自性故。
translation: It's because form has no existence and is the self-nature of form.

source_sentence: 受、想、行、識無縛無解。
translation: Feeling, perception, volition, and consciousness are not fettered or liberated.

source_sentence: 何以故？

translation: It's because feeling, perception, volition, and consciousness lack the self-nature of feeling, perception, volition, and consciousness.

source_sentence: 眼處乃至意處無縛無解。
translation: The sense-field of the eye and even the sense-field of the mind have no binding or liberation.

translation: It's because the sense-field of the eye and even the sense-field of mind have no existence, and it's because the sense-field of the eye and even the sense-field of mind have their own nature.

source_sentence: 色處乃至法處無縛無解。
translation: The form realm and even the Dharma realm are unfettered and unresolved.

source_sentence: 何以故？

source_sentence: 以色處乃至法處無所有性，為色處乃至法處自性故。
translation: It's because the form realm or even the Dharma realm has no existence, and it's because of the self-nature of the form realm or even the Dharma realm.

source_sentence: 「善現！
translation: “O Sunetra!

source_sentence: 眼界乃至意界無縛無解。
translation: The eye realm and even the mind realm are not fettered or liberated.

source_sentence: 何以故？
translation: Why is it so?

source_sentence: 以眼界乃至意界無所有性，為眼界乃至意界自性故。
translation: It's because the eye realm and even the mind realm lack the nature of existence, which is the self-nature of the eye realm and even the mind realm.

source_sentence: 色界乃至法界無縛無解。
translation: The form realm and even the Dharma realm are unfettered and unresolved.

source_sentence: 何以故？
translation: Why is it so?

source_sentence: 以色界乃至法界無所有性，為色界乃至法界自性故。
translation: It's because the form realm and even the Dharma realm have no existence, and it's because of the self-nature of the form realm and even the Dharma realm.

source_sentence: 眼識界乃至意識界無縛無解。
translation: The element of the eye, consciousness, and even the element of consciousness are not fettered or liberated.

source_sentence: 何以故？
translation: Why is it so?

source_sentence: 以眼識界乃至意識界無所有性，為眼識界乃至意識界自性故。
translation: It's because the element of eye consciousness and even the element of consciousness have no existence in the element of consciousness, which is the self-nature of the element of eye consciousness and even the element of consciousness.

source_sentence: 眼觸乃至意觸無縛無解。
translation: The contact of the eye and even the contact of the mind are not fettered or liberated.

source_sentence: 何以故？
translation: Why is it so?

source_sentence: 以眼觸乃至意觸無所有性，為眼觸乃至意觸自性故。
translation: It's because eye contact or even mental contact has no existence, and it's the self-nature of eye contact or even mental contact.

source_sentence: 眼觸為緣所生諸受乃至意觸為緣所生諸受無縛無解。
translation: The sensations that arise from visual contact as a condition and the sensations that arise from mental contact as a condition are not bound or liberated.

source_sentence: 何以故？
translation: Why is it so?

source_sentence: 以眼觸為緣所生諸受乃至意觸為緣所生諸受無所有性，為眼觸為緣所生諸受乃至意觸為緣所生諸受自性故。
translation: It's because the sensations that arise from visual contact as a condition and the sensations that arise from mental contact as a condition have no existence, and it's because the sensations that arise from visual contact as a condition and the sensations that arise from mental contact as a condition have their own nature.

source_sentence: 「善現！
translation: “O Sunetra!

source_sentence: 布施波羅蜜多乃至般若波羅蜜多無縛無解。
translation: The perfection of generosity and even the perfection of wisdom are unfettered and unresolved.

source_sentence: 何以故？
translation: Why is it so?

source_sentence: 以布施波羅蜜多乃至般若波羅蜜多無所有性，為布施波羅蜜多乃至般若波羅蜜多自性故。
translation: It's because the perfection of generosity and even the perfection of wisdom have no self-nature, and it's because the perfection of generosity and even the perfection of wisdom have self-nature.

source_sentence: 「善現！
translation: “O Sunetra!

source_sentence: 內空乃至無性自性空無縛無解。
translation: The internal emptiness or even the emptiness of the self-nature of absence of nature is empty, unfettered, and unresolved.

source_sentence: 何以故？
translation: Why is it so?

source_sentence: 以內空乃至無性自性空無所有性，為內空乃至無性自性空自性故。
translation: It's because internal emptiness or even the emptiness of the self-nature of naturelessness has no existence, and it's because internal emptiness or even the emptiness of the self-nature of naturelessness has no self-nature.

source_sentence: 「善現！
translation: “O Sunetra!

source_sentence: 四念住乃至八聖道支無縛無解。
translation: The four abodes of mindfulness up to the eightfold noble path are unfettered and unresolved.

source_sentence: 何以故？
translation: Why is it so?

source_sentence: 以四念住乃至八聖道支無所有性，為四念住乃至八聖道支自性故。
translation: It's because the four abodes of mindfulness and even the eight noble factors of the path lack their own nature, and it's because the four abodes of mindfulness and even the eight noble factors of the path lack their own nature.

source_sentence: 「善現！
translation: “O Sunetra!

source_sentence: 如是乃至如來十力乃至十八佛不共法無縛無解。
translation: Thus, it goes so far as to say that the Tathāgata's ten powers and even the 18 distinctive qualities of the Buddha are unfettered and unresolved.

source_sentence: 何以故？
translation: Why is it so?

source_sentence: 以如來十力乃至十八佛不共法無所有性，為如來十力乃至十八佛不共法自性故。
translation: It's because the Tathāgata's ten powers and even the 18 Buddha-uncommon dharmas lack their own nature, and it's because the Tathāgata's ten powers and even the 18 Buddha-uncommon dharmas lack their own nature.

source_sentence: 「善現！
translation: “O Sunetra!

source_sentence: 一切智無縛無解。
translation: All cognition has no binding and no understanding.

source_sentence: 何以故？
translation: Why is it so?

source_sentence: 以一切智無所有性，為一切智自性故。
translation: Because omniscience lacks the nature of existence, it is the self-nature of omniscience.

source_sentence: 道相智、一切相智無縛無解。
translation: Knowledge of the path and knowledge of all characteristics are unfettered and unresolved.

source_sentence: 何以故？
translation: Why is it so?

source_sentence: 以道相智、一切相智無所有性，為道相智、一切相智自性故。
translation: It's because knowledge of the path and knowledge of all characteristics have no existence as the self-nature of knowledge of the path and knowledge of all characteristics.

source_sentence: 「復次，善現！
translation: “Furthermore, Sunetra!

source_sentence: 色前際無縛無解。
translation: At the prior end of form, there's no binding and no understanding.

source_sentence: 何以故？
translation: Why is it so?

source_sentence: 以色前際無所有性，為色前際自性故。
translation: It is because the prior state of form has no existence: because it is the own-nature at the prior state of form.

source_sentence: 受、想、行、識前際無縛無解。
translation: At the frontier of feeling, perception, volition, and consciousness, there's no bondage or liberation.

source_sentence: 何以故？
